events.name: Security Wednesdays #9 - "Local Privilege Escalation – From Zero to Hero"
events.description:
Presentation Description:
Although “getting shell” is often the goal of any penetration tester, in reality that shell has low privileges with limited access to the local host or the real treasures it may hold.  To truly become a master of your domain you must be able to become UID 0 or NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM through a technique known as local privilege escalation.

This presentation will delve into the many methods of privilege escalation that exist in both Windows and Unix Systems and show you just how you can go from Hero to UID 0 in a flash.

Free pizza will be served before the talk at around 6:30pm (courtesy of Vantage Point)

Speaker's Biography:                                                                                 
Paul Craig leads the offensive security Penetration Testing team at Vantage Point, here in Sunny Singapore. Paul is an avid hacker with a passion for exploitation and has been hacking professionally for 13 years. Paul originally hails from New Zealand, the land of sheep.
events.location: NUS School of Computing - COM1 02-05 Cerebro@SoC

events.name: AWSUG March Meetup
events.description:
I'm pleased to announce that we will be holding our next AWS User Group meetup here in the AWS Singapore office on Weds, 23-March. 


Expect a similar format to the last couple of meetups, we will be hosting here in the AWS Singapore office again, kicking off at 7pm, Pizza and refreshments will be served. Talks will begin at 1920. We aim to keep them short at no more than 20 minutes each with Q&A at the end. 


Please get in touch if you have any proposals for content! 


AGENDA: Feedback System on SES & Docker: Kai Hendry Kai will talk about his experiences building a feedback system using SES and Docker, and will also cover off some of the tricks to get CORS working properly AWS New Instance Types and STREAM Benchmarking : Chin Gim Leong Abstract TBC Being Well Architected with Botmetric: Prashant Gyan Prashant from Minjar will talk about using Botmetric to hit the 4 Well Architected Pillars (Security, Reliablity, Performance and Cost) 


WHERE: The AWS Singapore office. https://goo.gl/maps/UzzR2 WHO CAN ATTEND: All are welcome! No prior experience needed. • Anyone who wants to know more about cloud computing and startup companies • Anyone who wants to understand the benefits of cloud computing and how to use the “cloud” to benefit their organization. • Startup founders and aspiring founders COST:  Free! Snacks will be served!
events.location: AWS Offices Singapore, 23 Church Street, Capital Square, #10-01, Singapore - 049481, +65-67220300
